security_audit.summary: No executable code or tool calls are present. The skill only contains descriptive guidance and references, with no data access or network behavior.

content.value_statement: You need TypeScript or JavaScript that follows Metabase conventions. This skill guides clean code and safe refactors using those standards.
actual_capabilities: Follow TypeScript and JavaScript best practices
limitations: Does not run or test code
Does not infer project conventions beyond Metabase standards
Does not modify files without explicit user requests

use_cases.title: Clean refactor
use_cases.description: Refactor TypeScript components to align with Metabase conventions and maintain readable code.

use_cases.title: Safe JS updates
use_cases.description: Update JavaScript utilities while keeping style and best practices consistent.

use_cases.title: Review helper
use_cases.description: Draft changes that match house standards before code review.

prompt_templates.title: Basic TS function
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a TypeScript function that formats dates and follows Metabase coding standards.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor JS file
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor this JavaScript function for clarity and maintain the same behavior. Follow Metabase standards.

prompt_templates.title: Type safety pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Add TypeScript types to this module without changing runtime behavior. Follow Metabase standards.

prompt_templates.title: API wrapper
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a TypeScript API wrapper module with clear types and error handling aligned to Metabase standards.

output_examples.input: Refactor this JS utility for readability and consistency.
output: Introduced clear function names and extracted helpers
Added inline types where needed for clarity
Preserved existing behavior while improving structure

best_practices: Provide relevant code context and constraints
State whether behavior must remain unchanged
Request explicit formatting or style preferences when needed
anti_patterns: Asking for code that ignores Metabase standards
Requesting behavior changes without specifying them
Omitting the target file or module context

faq.question: Is this compatible with my project?
faq.answer: It is compatible with TypeScript and JavaScript projects that can follow Metabase standards.

faq.question: Are there usage limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your Codex or Claude plan and the host environment.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my workflow tools?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not integrate directly with tools.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files?
faq.answer: No, it only provides instructions and does not access files or secrets.

faq.question: What if the output does not compile?
faq.answer: Provide the error message and context so it can adjust the code.

faq.question: How does it compare to general coding help?
faq.answer: It focuses on Metabase standards and best practices for TypeScript and JavaScript.
